item.title: HTTP Status Codes Explained: From 200 OK to 429 Too Many Requests
item.description: HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol) status codes are three-digit numbers returned by web servers (such as Apache, IIS, Nginx, Kestrel, among others) to indicate the outcome of a client‚Äôs request. These codes serve as communication tools between web clients (usually browsers and mobile applications) and servers about the outcome of the HTTP request. Let‚Äôs discuss HTTP status codes in a developer‚Äôs context Ô∏èüî®. When to Use Them Whenever a client makes a request (e.
